channel.title: Bold 9000 on mac as modem
channel.description:
I have been having trouble (yes i have used google) installing my blackberry bold 9000 as a tethered modem device on my macbook, it is the latest macbook with snow leopard os installed on it.
any personal experiences or help on the matter would be greatly appreciated.

item.title: Bold 9000 on mac as modem
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

that second link worked perfect, thanks alot!

the link for the modem script is broken, here is a working link: http://eugenedong.com/uploads/BlackBerry%203G%20CID1.zip

Read full topic

item.title: Bold 9000 on mac as modem
item.dc:creator: @sup000 sup000
item.description:
@sup000 wrote:

Hi, first of all, you have to check if you are using the bold os 4.6.0.190 or below. Above .190 there is no way to tether. Next, pair the 2 devices as usual. In system preferences>network, choose bluetooth and insert your carrier settings. Be sure to choose generic modem in advance settings. That's all. Simple like that.

Ps. It seens thar you are using .228. Downgrade to .190

stolen from some guy, somewhere

BUT ALSO:
http://forums.crackberry.com/f83/tethering-bold-9000-mac-over-bluetooth-4-6-0-247-a-180975/

Read full topic
